layman:
DIAGNOSIS: Patient wants a vasectomy.  
NAME OF OPERATION: Vasectomy.  
ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia.  

HISTORY: A 37‑year‑old man has asked for a vasectomy.  

PROCEDURE: The surgeon made a small cut in the middle of the scrotum. He found the right vas deferens, separated it from nearby tissue, clamped it, cut it, and tied it off with a 4‑0 chromic suture. No bleeding was seen. Using the same cut, he found the left vas deferens, cut it, tied it off, and put it back into the wound. Again, no bleeding was noted. The wound was closed with two layers of 4‑0 Vicryl sutures. The patient tolerated the surgery well. A sterile dressing was applied. He woke up and was moved to the recovery room in stable condition.
